tasks.title: Setup Astro 5.x Project with TypeScript
tasks.description: Initialize the project using Astro 5.x with TypeScript as the core framework, configure project structure, and set up development environment.
tasks.details:
1. Install Node.js and npm if not already installed
2. Create a new Astro project: `npm create astro@latest`
3. Select TypeScript configuration during setup
4. Configure project structure:
   - `/src/pages/` - For route-based pages
   - `/src/components/` - For React islands and UI components
   - `/src/layouts/` - For page layouts
   - `/src/styles/` - For global styles
   - `/src/utils/` - For utility functions
   - `/public/` - For static assets
5. Set up Git repository and initial commit
6. Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality
7. Set up CI/CD pipeline for deployment
8. Configure environment variables for development, staging, and production
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify Astro and TypeScript are correctly configured
2. Run development server and confirm it starts without errors
3. Test TypeScript compilation
4. Verify project structure follows best practices
5. Ensure hot module replacement works correctly
6. Test build process produces optimized output

tasks.title: Implement Tailwind CSS with Accessibility-First Design System
tasks.description: Set up Tailwind CSS and create an accessibility-first design system that meets WCAG 2.1 AA compliance standards.
tasks.details:
1. Install Tailwind CSS: `npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer`
2. Initialize Tailwind config: `npx tailwindcss init -p`
3. Configure content paths in tailwind.config.js
4. Create custom theme extending Tailwind defaults:
   - Define color palette with sufficient contrast ratios
   - Set up typography scale with accessible font sizes
   - Configure spacing and layout variables
5. Create accessibility-focused components:
   - High contrast mode toggle
   - Font scaling controls
   - Focus state indicators
6. Set up dark mode support
7. Create utility classes for common accessibility patterns
8. Implement design tokens for consistent styling
9. Configure Tailwind plugins for forms and typography
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Validate color contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards
2. Test with screen readers to ensure proper ARIA support
3. Verify keyboard navigation works across all components
4. Test responsive design across multiple device sizes
5. Validate font scaling and high contrast mode functionality
6. Run automated accessibility tests using axe or similar tools

tasks.title: Set Up Supabase Database and Provider Schema
tasks.description: Configure Supabase as the database backend and implement the provider directory schema with comprehensive provider data structure.
tasks.details:
1. Create Supabase project
2. Design and implement database tables:
   - `providers` table with fields for:
     - id (primary key)
     - name
     - description
     - contact information (phone, email, website)
     - address
     - hours of operation
     - eligibility requirements
     - insurance accepted
     - languages supported
     - accessibility features
   - `services` table with fields for:
     - id (primary key)
     - name
     - description
     - category
     - urgency level
   - `provider_services` junction table for many-to-many relationship
   - `locations` table with GPS coordinates and transportation options
   - `counties` table for geographic organization
3. Set up Row Level Security (RLS) policies
4. Create database indexes for optimized queries
5. Implement database migrations
6. Configure Supabase API endpoints
7. Set up initial seed data for testing
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify all tables are created with proper relationships
2. Test CRUD operations on all tables
3. Validate data integrity constraints
4. Test query performance with realistic data volumes
5. Verify security policies work as expected
6. Test API endpoints for correct data retrieval
7. Validate schema against all required provider data points from PRD

tasks.title: Implement Provider Directory Search and Filtering
tasks.description: Create advanced search functionality for the provider directory with text search, multi-filter system, and real-time results.
tasks.details:
1. Install and configure Fuse.js for client-side search: `npm install fuse.js`
2. Create search component with React:
   - Text input for keyword search
   - Filter controls for:
     - County selection (Middlesex, Somerset, Hunterdon)
     - Service type categories
     - Language options
     - Insurance filters
     - Urgency level selector
   - Results display with pagination
3. Implement search logic:
   - Text search across provider names, services, and descriptions
   - Multi-filter combination logic
   - Sorting options (distance, relevance, availability)
4. Create Supabase queries for filtered data retrieval
5. Implement debounced search for performance
6. Add clear filters functionality
7. Create mobile-friendly search interface
8. Implement search history and recent searches
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test search accuracy with various keywords and combinations
2. Verify all filters work correctly individually and in combination
3. Test performance with large dataset
4. Validate mobile responsiveness of search interface
5. Test keyboard accessibility of search controls
6. Verify screen reader compatibility
7. Test edge cases like empty results and partial matches

tasks.title: Develop Interactive Map with Google Maps API
tasks.description: Implement an interactive map showing provider locations with service-based color coding and location details.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Google Maps API integration:
   - Create Google Cloud project
   - Enable Maps JavaScript API
   - Generate API key with appropriate restrictions
2. Install required packages: `npm install @react-google-maps/api`
3. Create Map component with React:
   - Base map centered on Central NJ (Middlesex, Somerset, Hunterdon counties)
   - Custom markers for provider locations
   - Service-based color coding system
   - Info windows with provider details
   - Zoom and pan controls
4. Implement map features:
   - Clustering for dense provider areas
   - Filter controls linked to main search filters
   - Current location detection
   - Directions functionality
   - Accessibility information display
5. Optimize for mobile devices
6. Implement fallback for users without JavaScript
7. Add print functionality for map views
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Test map loading and rendering across browsers
2. Verify marker placement accuracy
3. Test info window content and interactions
4. Validate filter synchronization with main search
5. Test directions functionality
6. Verify mobile responsiveness and touch interactions
7. Test keyboard accessibility
8. Validate performance with many markers
